title: Why You Can't Settle For The "Minimum" In Your Minimum Viable Product
excerpt: Many startups scramble to create a "minimum viable product," or MVP, to get a version of their product to market quickly for testing. It’s a great way to cost-effectively test a website or app with real users. But be careful, if your MVP is too minimalist, it could torpedo your company's future.

title: The Ultimate Guide to Minimum Viable Products - Startup Growth
excerpt: You don’t want to waste your time and money building a product no one will want to use or pay for. So, first get out of the building and talk to your customers. title: Building a Minimum Viable Product is Like Serving Burnt Pizza — Build Lovable Products Instead
excerpt: Product builders should aim for lovable, not just viable. Jiaona Zhang (product leader at Dropbox, Airbnb, WeWork and lecturer at Stanford) shares her tactics for building MLPs that win users' hearts.
